byline.original: By STEPHANIE CLIFFORD and JAMES C. McKINLEY Jr

abstract: New York State will adopt standard bar examination developed by National Conference of Bar Examiners, which will give lawyers flexibility to move and practice in other states; 15 states already use test but New York is so far the largest; in addition to standard exam, new plan will require lawyers to take online course and pass short multiple-choice test on state-specific law before becoming licensed in New York.
lead_paragraph: The state’s chief judge said he expected the move to result in a “domino effect” with the remaining states, given New York’s prominence in the legal world.

headline.main: New York to Adopt a Uniform Bar Exam Used in 15 Other States
headline.print_headline: New York to Adopt a Uniform Bar Exam Used in 15 Other States

snippet: The state’s chief judge said he expected the move to result in a “domino effect” with the remaining states, given New York’s prominence in the legal world.
